text: Mete Binay (born 19 January 1985 in Emirseyit, Tokat) is a Turkish world champion weightlifter competing in the -69 kg division. He won the bronze medal at the 2010 European Weightlifting Championships held in Minsk, Belarus, gold medal at the 2010 World Weightlifting Championships held in Antalya, Turkey and gold medal in snatch event at the 2011 World Weightlifting Championships held in Paris, France. On 3 July 2020 the International Olympic Committee disqualified Binay from the 2012 Olympic Games, and struck his results from the record for failing a drugs test in a re-analysis of his doping sample from 2012. ==Medals== World Championships {|border=0 cellpadding=2 cellspacing=2 |- bgcolor=#CCCCCC |Rank||Discipline||Snatch||Clean&Jerk;||Total||Place||Date |- bgcolor=#CCFFCC | || rowspan=2 | -69 kg || 160.0 || || || rowspan=2 |Antalya, Turkey|| rowspan=2 | Sep 21, 2010 |- bgcolor=#CCFFCC | ' || || || 335.0' |- bgcolor=#CCFFCC | || -69 kg || 157.0 || || || |Paris, France|| Nov 8, 2011 |} European Championships {|border=0 cellpadding=2 cellspacing=2 |- bgcolor=#CCCCCC |Rank||Discipline||Snatch||Clean&Jerk;||Total||Place||Date |- bgcolor=#CCFFCC | || -69 kg || 154.0 || || || |Kazan, Russia|| Apr 11-17, 2011 |- bgcolor=#CCFFCC | || rowspan=2 | -69 kg || 149.0 || || || rowspan=2 |Minsk, Belarus|| rowspan=2 | Apr 2-11, 2010 |- bgcolor=#CCFFCC | ' || || || 314.0 |} ==References== ==External links== *International Weightlifting Federation Category:1985 births Category:Living people Category:World Weightlifting Championships medalists Category:People from Tokat Category:Turkish male weightlifters Category:Olympic weightlifters of Turkey Category:Weightlifters at the 2012 Summer Olympics Category:European Weightlifting Championships medalists Category:Doping cases in weightlifting Category:Turkish sportspeople in doping cases
